contentrichtext.text: '''[[John Wilmot]]''', 2nd Earl of Rochester (1647–1680), was an English libertine, friend of King Charles II, and writer of satirical and bawdy poetry. '''John Wilmot''' may also refer to: * Sir [[John Eardley Wilmot]] PC (1709–1792), Chief Justice of the Common Pleas 1766–1771 * [[John Wilmot (politician)]] (1748–1815), MP for Tiverton and later for Coventry * [[Sir John Eardley-Wilmot, 1st Baronet]] (1783–1847), Governor of Tasmania, MP for Warwickshire North 1832–1843 * [[Sir John Eardley-Wilmot, 2nd Baronet]] (1810–1892), MP for Warwickshire South 1874–1885 * [[John Wilmot, 1st Baron Wilmot of Selmeston]] (1895–1964), British Labour Party MP and Minister of Supply * [[John McNeil Wilmot]] (c. 1755–1847), Canadian politician {{hndis|name=Wilmot, John}}
